physical_appearance: This is a warrant document. The title is printed at the center top of he document. The warrant is printed in cursive font, with fields for names and dates filled in in handwritten black ink. There is a signature at the bottom-right corner in purple ink. There is an 'Emergency' stamp on the top right corner. The edges of the document is slightly folded.
sgcool_label_text: Loose papers from the James Steele, P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing, Japanese banana money, map of camp, administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment, list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steeleâ€™s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Miscellaneous scraps of paper from P.O.W James Steele Archives (30 pieces) P.O.W. James Steele Archives: Warrant
subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war documents (object genre)
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Warrants (Law)
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
